alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 3:49PM CDT until May 16 at 3:01PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River near Speaks. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with the approaches to the FM 530 bridge inundated and the gage cut off. large areas of the floodplain are cut off potentially isolated and drowning cattle. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 20.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 26.7 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.3 feet on 10/14/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Navidad River Speaks 24.0 20.8 Sat 3 pm CDT 25.6 26.4 20.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CDT.
